name: Cocktaileer Bmore
bio:
Husband and wife duo drinking our way through the best cocktail bars we can find!
Born in Detroit.
All original content. Featured on @imbibe

social_posts.post_text: Final Colada from Bloom’s inside the @hotelulysses. Rhum Agricole, Green Chartreuse, fennel-coriander coconut and lime. This take on a Last Word mixed with a Pina Colada is herbal, earthy and acidic. The vegetal and herbal notes from Rhum pair perfectly with Chartreuse and the infused coconut gives this cocktail nice body and texture. Almost every surface in Bloom’s is mirrored.. one too many of these might just have you seeing double… 😂🤣 Thanks for the cocktail @halfwolf_halfbartender!

@rocket_to_venus, a gem of a neighborhood bar in the heart of Hampden. They offer a cocktail menu with something for everyone along with beer and an awesome food menu. We’ve really been enjoying this place and can’t wait to get back and try more cocktails!

Italicus Spritz from @ashbar. Bergamotto liqueur and sparkling wine. Sometimes simplicity is better than complexity and the Italicus Spritz proves it. Hints of bergamot, rose, lavender and chamomile paired with sparkling wine gives a refreshing and flavorful cocktail. The perfect drink for the incredible vibe that Ash bar gives.

Little Snow White from @thebluebirdbaltimore. Civic vodka, @donciccioefigli Ambrosia, house made plum jam, lemon and egg white. Such a delicious cocktail with notes of blood orange, cantelope and plum paired with acidic lemon and the silky smooth texture from egg white. The perfect cocktail for late night imbibing in a dark bar.

The Water of Life from @thebluebirdbaltimore. @cottonandreed Mellow Gold rum, @owneysrum, @maggiesfarmrum Falernum, spiced pear shrub, lime, house aromatic bitters and @tenthwardco Absinthe Nouvelle. I love a shrub in a cocktail and the spiced pear shrub pairs so well with the mix of rum. This cocktail is refreshing and easy to drink but still offers a nice dynamic flavor.

Ménage a Framboise from @nowayrosebaltimore.  Rum, rose wine, sweet rose water, citrus, Lillet Rouge ice. Refreshing, floral, crushable. The cocktails at No Way Rosé are approachable, well balanced and fun to drink. The bar is well stocked and the atmosphere is fun and energetic. Thanks for the drinks @tierney_mona!!

🚨 NEW BAR 🚨 Spicy Sunset from @ammoorabaltimore. Lebanese rosé, orange ambrosia aperitif, ginger syrup and soda water. Ammoora is bringing Middle Eastern flavors to Baltimore with their delicious new cocktail menu. It’s been hard finding great Middle Eastern food/drinks since leaving Detroit a few years ago and Ammoora is very much welcomed. All of the drinks were great and the food was especially delicious. Highly recommend giving them a try!

Not Far Down to Paradise from @wet_city. Cachaça, Aquavit, walnut liqueur, lime, pineapple, Underberg, bitters and orange peel. Did you know that Wet City has an awesome cocktail program? Not only do they have some of my favorite sour beers, Wet City has an excellent list of cocktails that is always rotating. Definitely check them out whether you’re a beer or cocktail lover… or both!

Persephone from The Club Charles. Lemon Vodka, Pama pomegranate liqueur and pineapple juice. The Club Charles quickly became one of our favorite bars in Baltimore and chances are you’ll see us there on the weekend. This is Jodi’s favorite cocktail off their menu. It’s refreshing, acidic and easily crushable. We’re not usually fans of vodka but this cocktail is perfect.

Drinkable Arrangements from @bsccocktailgallery. @baltspiritsco Barrel Aged Shot Tower gin, Sing #9, strawberry syrup, lemon and egg white. Fruity and silky smooth. This cocktail is made with BSC’s Singularity #9, a Oaxacan chili chocolate liqueur. Sing #9 is part of their experimental one-off ideas that’s always make their cocktails so unique.

A Gimlet from @thewurstbar. Gin, lime and simple topped with an egg white foam. A delicious classic with a fun twist. The egg white foam adds nice texture to this well known classic cocktail. The Wurst and their staff were fantastic. The entire menu is based on the classics and they’re done exceptionally well. Highly recommend checking this place out next time you’re in Federal Hill. Thanks for the drink @the_dannydubois!

Blood and Sand from @thebluebirdbaltimore. @catoctincreek Rye whiskey, @thewinecollectivebaltimore vermouth, fermented beet and orange, and orange oleo saccharum. Complex and funky. Loving the new menu over at Bluebird. Each classic cocktail is paired with a Bluebird creation based on the original potentially opening up one to new flavors and combinations. Saw this Blood and Sand from across the bar and had to order it on the color alone. Gorgeous!

Le Nouvel An from @cookhousecafebar. “A mezcal cocktail with Yellow Chartreuse and blueberry caviar.” A delicious cocktail with a fun experience. Smoky, herbal, and well balanced with the blueberry “caviar” adding a nice fruity burst of flavor. We were very impressed with CookHouse. It’s a gorgeous space in Bolton Hill with an elevated and diverse cocktail menu. Definitely will be back very soon!

Spa Water from @dutchcourageginbar. @wildrootsspirits grapefruit-cucumber gin, Mattei blanc, @chareauspirit aloe liqueur, Folkington’s garden tonic, cucumber, mint, and dehydrated lemon. This cocktail may have no color but I assure you it is full of flavor. Refreshing, botanical and of the earth. This is exactly what you want to be sipping on when you’re relaxing at the pool or spa. Thanks for the drink @pat_turner!

🚨NEW BAR🚨 @thecoralwig is Baltimore’s newest cocktail bar to be found in the back alley inside @hotelulysses. This is the Pink Snapper - @barbancourtrhum_usa 8 Year, island strawberry, lime and sansho peppercorn. The Coral Wig, sister bar to @wcharlan, is dark, gorgeous, and well curated… exactly what you’d expect. The cocktail menu features select rums and cocktails with tropical vibe just in time for the summer weather. Definitely add this bar to the top of your list. Cheers!

Peanut & Pepper from @findtheelk. Bacardi Cuatro rum, apricot, @baltspiritsco Szechuan Amaro, lime and @mingriverbaijiu Baijiu. This cocktail does not taste as it appears. I was pleasantly surprised with notes of fruit, acidity, and heat! This is an extremely delicious cocktail that has depth and is well balanced. Thanks for the drink @palpable_soul!

Blueberry & Chamomile from @findtheelk. @mezcalvago Elote mezcal, Nixta Elote liqueur, pink peppercorn and Vetiver. Earthy, vegetal and complex. Another cocktail from Elk Room that is as good as it looks. The menu is diverse and fun to navigate, the space is absolutely gorgeous and the staff are wonderful. Thanks again for another fantastic drink @palpable_soul.

Mountain of the Sun created by @dallydub from @thebluebirdbaltimore. @elsilencio mezcal, @donciccioefigli Tepache, watermelon and pink peppercorn sour syrup. Sweet watermelon pairs perfectly with smoky and earthy mezcal and Tepache adds notes of pineapple and other botanicals. Very dynamic flavors here and only four ingredients! Bravo Dal! Thanks for the drink @cocktailsandcocktaildresses!

@melanies_griffithstavern has become a staple for us here in Baltimore. Fantastic staff, great atmosphere, wonderful patrons and of course delicious cocktails. They usually have one or two cocktail specials running but will make you anything you want. Thanks for the drink Hannah!

@frankies_tiki_room is always a must visit for us when we’re in Vegas. About 15 minutes off the strip in a gas station parking lot you’ll find one of the most transformative tiki experiences. Such an awesome atmosphere. They have a line of custom tiki mugs that are very affordable. Only one more mug and we will have the entire collection! Definitely a must visit if you’re in town.

Persephone from The Club Charles. Lemon vodka, @pamaliqueur Pomegranate liqueur and pineapple juice. There’s something magical about this cocktail.. I don’t know if it’s the cocktail or the atmosphere or a combination of both that makes it great but you must have it. Club Charles instantly became one of our favorite bars in Baltimore as soon as we walked through the door. Excellent cocktails, fantastic staff and an atmosphere that cannot be matched.

Grandstand from @velveteenrabbitlv. Rye, house-made mandarin oleo cordial, espelette pepper, Hellfire and Peychaud’s bitters, sweet grass smoke. Velveteen Rabbit is always a day one stop when in Vegas. We stumbled upon this bar years ago and are always exposed to new flavors. Their current menu is inspired by the county fair and it is full of experimental flavors and fun experiences. Definitely add this bar to the top of your places to visit in Vegas.

Top Lava Last Word from the @owlbar inside The Belvedere Hotel. 

@aviationgin Gin
Genepy
Maraschino Liqueur 
Lemon Juice
 
Similar to a classic Last Word, this variation substitutes Green Chartreuse for Genepy and lime for lemon giving a similar but refreshing take. Owl Bar is serving special cocktails (and decorations) for the Halloween season. Go check them out before it’s too late! 

#cocktails #craftcocktails #baltimore

Naked & Famous from @idlehourbaltimore. El Búho mezcal, Yellow Chartreuse, Aperol and fresh lime. Herbal, earthy and acidic. Idlehour is Chartreuse heaven full of delicious cocktails, good music and an even better atmosphere. If this was the last bar on earth I would die happy.
Did you know that @melanies_griffithstavern always has rotating gin and vodka infusions? Perfect for you vodka/gin and tonic lovers!

Husband and wife duo drinking our way through the best cocktail bars we can find!
Born in Detroit.
All original content. Featured on @imbibe
